title: anvil_reset cannot start forking, anvil must be already forking
body:
### Component

Anvil

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (d5c51a5 2023-09-10T00:26:11.552502000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

anvil

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

It seems like `anvil_reset` is almost at feature parity with `hardhat_reset`, but it's missing one thing. With the hardhat node, you can actually enable forking even if the hardhat node had never been forking before, by passing the following params to `hardhat_reset`:
```json
{ "forking": {"jsonRpcUrl": "<fork_url>" }
```
This will start forking from the latest block on `fork_url` even if the hardhat node was started as purely a local dev node.

Trying the same procedure against anvil yields a `Forking not enabled` error. I've tracked it down to this line: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/blob/d5c51a5007805486ee5a456d35865e0ee440c8a7/crates/anvil/src/eth/backend/mem/mod.rs#L415

I'd like to bring anvil to feature parity with the hardhat RPC here and allow forking to be set for the first time via RPC. If maintainers agree, happy to open a PR.
